intro: Dolicholus laetissimus, commonly known as the joyous longleaf, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and parks for its attractive foliage and floral display.
